definition: to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)

sentences.english: Our journey has never been one of short-cuts or settling for less.
sentences.chinese: 我們的征途中從來沒有不勞而獲或小富即安。

sentences.english: The worst guilt is to accept an unearned guilt.
sentences.chinese: 最嚴重的罪行是接受一個不勞而獲的罪行。

sentences.english: Our company will never afford (free lunch for )the unearned people.
sentences.chinese: 喫白飯，意爲不勞而獲，喫免費的午餐。

sentences.english: The present system of reaping without sowing should cease immediately.
sentences.chinese: 目前這種不勞而獲的制度應當立即廢止。

sentences.english: The abolition of incomes unearned by work.
sentences.chinese: 第十一條，取締不勞而獲的收入。

sentences.english: Liu said one of her favorite English mottos is "No one can achieve anything without effort".
sentences.chinese: 劉表示她最喜歡的英語格言是“沒有人能不勞而獲。”

sentences.english: Nothing to be got without pains but ignorance.
sentences.chinese: 只有無知是可以不勞而獲的。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, no amount of happiness can be achieved without hard- working.
sentences.chinese: 同時，沒有不勞而獲的巨大幸福。

sentences.english: Continue to work with the faith that unearned suffering is redemptive.
sentences.chinese: 繼續用信心工作不勞而獲的苦楚是贖回的。

sentences.english: Don't be so childish if you think you can get something for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 別這麼孩子氣，如果你認爲你能夠不勞而獲。

sentences.english: Do you think a copycat is hateful to make achievements out of nothing?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲抄襲者不勞而獲的行爲可恨嗎？

sentences.english: No pains no gains, hard work a path to success.
sentences.chinese: 不勞而獲，努力工作是通往成功之路。

definition: lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
evil has its retribution (idiom); to suffer the consequences of one's bad deeds/sow the wind and reap the whirlwind (Hosea 8:7)
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to seek nothing but profit (idiom); personal profit before everything/self-seeking
